thread.title: Elkhorn farm brewery Duesterbeck's is coming to Milwaukee retail
thread.title_full: Elkhorn farm brewery Duesterbeck's is coming to Milwaukee retail

author: Bobby Tanzilo
title: Elkhorn farm brewery Duesterbeck's is coming to Milwaukee retail
text:
- A weekend full of fun and flavor is coming. Get a taste of it all at the
Craft Beer Walk and Dells On TapOctober 18-19.
Elkhorn's family-owned Duesterbeck’s Brewing Company has partnered with Beer Capitol to distribute the farm brewery's beers in bars, liquor stores, restaurants and grocery stores in greater Milwaukee.
You can
read a story about the history of Duesterbeck's, founded in 2019, here.
“Expanding to the Milwaukee area has always been a goal for us. It allows us to share our story and our beer with even more of our Wisconsin family,” said co-owner and founder Ben Johnson.
“We’re proud to be rooted in Elkhorn, and we’re excited to have Milwaukeeans experience a piece of our farm life through every pour.”
These are the Duesterbeck's brews (with descriptions from Johnson) that will be distributed in Milwaukee:
- Barn Quilt Blondie: A light and refreshing blonde ale that celebrates the colorful barn quilts of Wisconsin’s farmlands. Crisp and approachable, this brew is perfect for any occasion.
- Dairy Air Hazy IPA: Bold yet balanced, Dairy Air Hazy IPA delivers a juicy hop flavor with notes of citrus and tropical fruits. Named for our dairy farm roots, this hazy IPA is a crowd favorite for those who enjoy a more adventurous flavor profile.
- Pig Farmer Pale Ale: Inspired by our farming background, Pig Farmer Pale Ale offers a balanced malt body with just the right amount of hop bitterness, delivering a smooth and easy-drinking experience.
- Roosterbeck Amber Ale: This rich and malty amber ale packs a slightly sweet caramel flavor with a subtle hop finish. Roosterbeck Amber Ale pays homage to the early risers and hardworking farmers that inspire us.
- Nutty Bill’s Peanut Butter Porter: Creamy, smooth, and packed with real peanut butter flavor, Nutty Bill’s Porter is a decadent dessert beer that satisfies with every sip.
For more information on Duesterbeck’s and a beer finder, go to
dbcbrewery.com.
Born in Brooklyn, N.Y., where he lived until he was 17, Bobby received his BA-Mass Communications from UWM in 1989 and has lived in Walker's Point, Bay View, Enderis Park, South Milwaukee and on the East Side.
He has published three non-fiction books in Italy – including one about an event in Milwaukee history, which was published in the U.S. in autumn 2010. Four more books, all about Milwaukee, have been published by The History Press.
With his most recent band, The Yell Leaders, Bobby released four LPs and had a songs featured in episodes of TV's "Party of Five" and "Dawson's Creek," and films in Japan, South America and the U.S. The Yell Leaders were named the best unsigned band in their region by VH-1 as part of its Rock Across America 1998 Tour. Most recently, the band contributed tracks to a UK vinyl/CD tribute to the Redskins and collaborated on a track with Italian novelist Enrico Remmert.
He's produced three installments of the "OMCD" series of local music compilations for OnMilwaukee.com and in 2007 produced a CD of Italian music and poetry.
In 2005, he was awarded the City of Asti's (Italy) Journalism Prize for his work focusing on that area. He has also won awards from the Milwaukee Press Club.
He has be heard on 88Nine Radio Milwaukee talking about his "Urban Spelunking" series of stories, in that station's most popular podcast.
